doc:
Cyril McLaglen https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyril_McLaglen 0 Cyril McLaglen (1899–1987) was a British actor who appeared in a variety of films between 1920 and 1951. He was born in London in 1899 and made his film debut in the 1920 film The Call of the Road. He was the younger brother of the actor Victor McLaglen.McLaglen enjoyed success in the late silent era, and was placed under contract to Gainsborough Pictures, appearing in some of the studio's biggest films of the late 1920s. His career started to falter with the arrival of sound and he began to appear in low-budget quota quickies. In the mid-1930s he emigrated to the United States, but his roles in Hollywood were even more limited and often consisted in small, often uncredited roles. His screen career had wound down by 1942, but he made one final appearance in the 1951 film Soldiers Three. Cyril_McLaglen ( 1899 – 1987 ) was a_British_actor who appeared in a_variety of films between 1920_and_1951 . His_career started_to_falter with the_arrival of sound and he began_to_appear in low-budget_quota_quickies . In the_mid-1930s he emigrated to the_United_States , but his_roles in Hollywood were even_more_limited and often_consisted in small , often_uncredited_roles . His_screen_career had_wound down by_1942 , but he made one_final_appearance in the_1951_film_Soldiers_Three .
